definitions.labels: (especially US English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)(British English)(North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: We have two sons and a daughter.
She's the **eldest daughter** of an Oxford professor.
Living alone and trying to bring up a small daughter is no easy task.

definitions.definition: a woman who belongs to a particular place or country, etc.

examples.text: one of the town’s most famous daughters

wordOrigin: Old English dohtor, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dochter and German Tochter, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek thugatēr.
